code: output_dir <- here::here("data-raw", "countries_samplings") country_focus <- "India"  dir.create(output_dir, showWarnings = FALSE) # Asset Impact params  # WARNING: This article isn't reproducible. You need this data. path_ar_data_raw <-   r2dii.utils::path_dropbox_2dii(     "ST_INPUTS",     "ST_INPUTS_PRODUCTION",     "AR-Company-Indicators_2022Q4.xlsx"   )   # leave empty to use all countries # country_filter <- c() country_filter <- countrycode::codelist %>%   filter(country.name.en == country_focus) %>%   dplyr::pull(.data$ecb)  # only use assets with HQ in the selected countries filter_hqs <- TRUE # only use assets in the selected countries filter_assets <- FALSE # use both : only use HQs in the country with assets in the country  # abcd  params ======================================== start_year <- 2022 # defined in workflow.R time_horizon <- 5 additional_year <- NULL sector_list <- c("Automotive", "Power", "Oil&Gas", "Coal", "Cement", "Steel") km_per_vehicle <- 15000

what: build and save the stat desc
title: country_specific_dataprep
text: Number companies per country Number companies per sector Number companies per Business Unit (BU) Unique company count Business Unit distribution Sector distribution Geographies distribution
code: library(openxlsx) library(dplyr) library(readr) # Assuming data reading might be necessary library(tidyr) # For data manipulation  # Assuming the DB_company_activities and abcd_stress_test_input are already loaded and prepared as per your Rmd  # Create a new workbook wb <- createWorkbook()  # Helper function to add data to the workbook add_data_sheet <- function(wb, data, sheetName) {   addWorksheet(wb, sheetName)   writeData(wb, sheetName, data) }  # Number of companies per country companies_per_country <- DB_company_activities %>%   distinct(company_id, ald_location) %>%   group_by(ald_location) %>%   summarise(n = n()) %>%   arrange(desc(n)) add_data_sheet(wb, companies_per_country, "Unique Companies per Country")  # Unique company count unique_companies_count <- length(unique(DB_company_activities$company_id)) unique_companies_sheet <- data.frame(Unique_Companies_Count = unique_companies_count) add_data_sheet(wb, unique_companies_sheet, "UC Count RAWDATA")  # Unique company count unique_companies_count <- length(unique(abcd_stress_test_input$company_id)) unique_companies_sheet <- data.frame(Unique_Companies_Count = unique_companies_count) add_data_sheet(wb, unique_companies_sheet, "UC Count ABCD")   # Business Unit distribution bu_distribution <- abcd_stress_test_input %>%   filter(scenario_geography=="Global") %>%   distinct(company_id, ald_sector, ald_business_unit) %>%   group_by(ald_sector, ald_business_unit) %>%   summarise(n_business_unit = n()) %>%   arrange(desc(n_business_unit)) add_data_sheet(wb, bu_distribution, "UC BU Global geo")  # Sector distribution sector_distribution <- abcd_stress_test_input %>%   filter(scenario_geography=="Global") %>%   distinct(company_id, ald_sector) %>%   group_by(ald_sector) %>%   summarise(n_sectors = n()) %>%   arrange(desc(n_sectors)) add_data_sheet(wb, sector_distribution, "UC Sector Global geo")  # Geographies distribution geographies_distribution <- abcd_stress_test_input %>%   distinct(company_id, scenario_geography) %>%   group_by(scenario_geography) %>%   summarise(n_companies = n()) %>%   arrange(desc(n_companies)) add_data_sheet(wb, geographies_distribution, "UC Geographies Distribution")  # Save the workbook to a file # Construct file name using the country_focus and suffix  # Full path to the output file file_name <- paste0("descriptive_statistics_", country_focus, "_", suffix, ".xlsx") output_file_path <- here::here(output_dir, file_name) saveWorkbook(wb, output_file_path, overwrite = TRUE)  cat("Excel file with descriptive statistics saved to:", file_name, "\n")

title: run_synthetic_workflow
code: company_activities <- STDataMGMT::synthetic_company_activities company_emissions <- STDataMGMT::synthetic_company_emissions  start_year <- 2020 time_horizon <- 10 additional_year <- NULL sector_list <- c("Automotive", "Power", "Oil&Gas", "Coal") km_per_vehicle <- 15000  abcd_stress_test_input <-   STDataMGMT::prepare_abcd_data(     company_activities = company_activities,     company_emissions = company_emissions,     scenarios_geographies = STDataMGMT::scenarios_geographies,     start_year = start_year,     time_horizon = time_horizon,     additional_year = additional_year,     km_per_vehicle = km_per_vehicle,     sector_list = sector_list   )   # knitr::kable(abcd_stress_test_input) print(abcd_stress_test_input)

title: run_synthetic_workflow
code: company_activities <- STDataMGMT::synthetic_company_activities eikon_data <- STDataMGMT::synthetic_eikon_data   companies_data <- company_activities |> dplyr::distinct(company_id, ald_sector, ald_location)  prewrangled_financial_data_stress_test <- STDataMGMT::prepare_financial_data(   financial_data = eikon_data,   companies_data = companies_data,   ownership_tree = NULL,   minimum_sample_size = 1,   minimum_ratio_sample = 0,   allowed_range_npm = c(-Inf, Inf) )  prewrangled_financial_data_stress_test <- prewrangled_financial_data_stress_test %>%   dplyr::inner_join(abcd_stress_test_input %>% dplyr::distinct(company_id))  # knitr::kable(prewrangled_financial_data_stress_test) print(prewrangled_financial_data_stress_test)

what: This function reads in the long format prepared price data from IEA scenarios that contain the LCOE for the power sector. It then derives implied market prices. This is done by adding the average net profit margin of the 100 largest power companies we can find on top of the costs of the start year. The absolute margin in that year is then added to all following years as well. We adjust the price by calculating the cost changes for each technology and scenario as lcoe_t0 / lcoe_t and applying the resulting cost factor to the absolute profit margin in each year. This means that if costs increase, the absolute average profit margin will be smaller over time, whereas falling costs will increase the absolute profit margin over time. — prepare_lcoe_adjusted_price_data_weo
